35CF72A69B884C60BD8896A1E6CD7105.description: Document sources and integrate quotations by adhering to journalistic conventions and reference tools (e.g., The Canadian Press Stylebook and New Canadian Media Ethnic Media & Diversity Style Guide).

5846D57659B44C18991491AC4DD42337.description: Evaluate the credibility of sources by determining: why the information was created; if the information presented is fact or opinion; if the factual information can be confirmed by other sources; the point of view and possible bias; and, who created the information.

835B864C88B84906B92582E6EB0B519B.description: Conduct extensive research to verify facts and elaborate with details.

D906F005473D42AEA47FA03053F55465.description: Locate, assess and summarize information from a variety of sources.

53CCCF34C687405498F915B2E2113A30.description: Record details (e.g., habits, customs, human institutions, cultural groups, events and natural world) of everyday life as documentable and symbolic subject matter that contributes to social understanding.

949FCBB1F1D548B49842F76DA1909997.description: Explore the elements (e.g., timeliness, proximity, prominence, conflict, progress and emotions) of a newsworthy story.

3E1FA51C0BBD4D81BAE87D3CFAC9522E.description: Employ journalistic research skills to gather and communicate information.

50EB2791D4F042F3BC4F03C844F2CBDF.description: Compose interview questions that: require more than yes/no answers and are open-ended; incorporate who, what, where, when, why and how; invite the interviewee’s opinion or narrative; and, demonstrate evidence of background research.

FA771E3AC2D44FB7A55B1CDB03C2BF47.description: Apply elements of effective interview skills: Engage with the source’s ideas, arguments and work. Be flexible and prepared to change the direction of an interview. Demonstrate a courteous, professional and neutral demeanour. Use a variety of techniques (e.g., pause, redirect, ask probing or open-ended questions) to elicit responses. Maintain an independence of judgement. Allow the subject to do the talking., Confirm the source’s agreement to the interview format and process. and Ask for the source’s permission to call back if the need arises.

C5E3FF8BB9E2498EAD697E46DD4AFFA5.description: Employ a variety of notetaking tools (e.g., charts, lists and digital recordings), with the source’s agreement.

537F63FC69D241B5AC23289266900C54.description: Demonstrate effective, active listening behaviours: Listen with a purpose to understand and learn., Adapt listening and focus to the purpose and situation (e.g., in person, telephone and virtual conference), Identify the ways the speaker communicates (e.g., word choice, tempo and tone)., Recognize the overall key ideas and issues., Interact appropriately for clarification. Recognize the speaker’s attitude and bias and Recall and summarize the main ideas and conclusions.

57C037FD6E15463B8D2E0E0A87787719.description: Employ appropriate eye contact (cognizant of cultural variations and norms), speaking rate, volume, enunciation, inflection and gestures to communicate ideas effectively.

8675D1445D8F4360A325A9286B5EC594.description: Use oral language that is respectful and inclusive to build relationships and a sense of community (e.g., cultural and linguistic background).

FD48470DDF1940B0B936C5EF70249B2D.description: Examine print, broadcast and photojournalism texts for accuracy, style and journalistic conventions.

6D34CFDE7A4041C884279F1E9E792FD3.description: Examine journalistic ethics, rights and responsibilities.
